• Explore the Whitsundays and Great Barrier Reef aboard a lively mega yacht
• Huge waterslide, scuba diving, heated spa, and an action-packed itinerary
• The #1 social boat in the Whitsundays with up to 54 guests aged 18 to 35
• Snorkel the Great Barrier Reef, explore Whitehaven Beach and venture to Hill Inlet
• Air-conditioned cabins and hot showers
Overview
Clipper Highlights
• Brand new, epic water slide
• Snorkel the Great Barrier Reef
• Scuba diving available
• Visit Whitehaven Beach
• Social trip with up to 54 guests
• Heated on-deck spa
• Stand-up paddle boards
• Fresh meals included
• Air-conditioned vessel
• Snorkel gear + wetsuits provided
• Experienced dive instructors
• Fun, experienced crew
• BYO Alcohol

**Show Less**

Whitehaven Beach
Soak up the sun on the world-famous Whitehaven Beach! Chill out on the soft silica sand or play beach games with your new friends and the Clipper crew! Voted the best beach in Australia, Whitehaven Beach must-see while in the Whitsundays. Strecthing over 7km, relax in tropical paradise on Whitehaven Beach, have a laugh with your new friends and take it all in!
Snorkelling and scuba diving
Snorkelling and scuba diving amongst the diverse range of marine life and coral species found in the Whitsundays is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity! The Clipper offers both certified and introductory dives for an unreal underwater experience. Your onboard scuba dive includes all gear hire and an experienced dive instructor, for all comfort levels. All dives are subject to age, conditions and medical questions. If you are a certified diver you will need to bring diving certification card with you. All diving MUST be pre-booked and paid for on board. We follow above PADI standards with only two divers per instructor as your safety is of utmost importance to us and we want you to feel comfortable and safe at all times.
Stand-up paddle boards, waterslides, spa and fun!
There are many ways to enjoy your time on Atlantic Clipper with an array of epic water sports available! For the thrill seekers, Atlantic Clipper has two waterslides, one which is 8 metres long with a 5 metre drop to the sea, and another which is a massive 9 metres long! Stand-up paddle board over calm, glassy waters and even test your yoga skills on the board! One of our favourite things to do at the end of the day is to jump into the huge spa located on Atlantic Clipper's deck... There's no better place to unwind and watch the sunset after a big day of exploring the Whitsundays with new friends! Once the sun has set, the Atlantic Clipper turns on its night lights to attract all sorts of sea life that you wouldn't get to see during the day, such as squid, dolphins, reef sharks and nocturnal fish.
One of the best times you can have on a holiday
Exclusive After-Party at Mama Africa's Nightclub
Just because the trip ends, does not mean the end of the service! Atlantic Clipper offers an exclusive after-party organised at Mama Africa's Nightclub in Airlie Beach. This is your chance to have one final hoorah with your crew and enjoy VIP discounts on drinks.

**Vessel Specifications**

The mighty Atlantic Clipper is the largest and one of the most popular tours in the Whitsundays. Coming in at 111 feet and taking up to 54 passengers per trip, she's the perfect vessel for fun-loving adventurers looking for the trip of a lifetime. Built in 1983 and combines the awesome adventure of sailing, snorkelling and scuba diving, with modern facilities and air conditioning throughout. ...
Make the most of two waterslides, an onboard spa, multiple cabins, spacious common areas and panoramic viewing decks. Cruise smoothly amongst the protected Whitsunday Islands in style aboard the iconic Atlantic Clipper!

**Layout**

Choose from private doubles, triple share and quad share cabins all with the comfort of air-conditioning throughout. The spectacular air-conditioned saloon, featuring a large dining area and lounge, offers a gigantic area to socialise and meet new friends. With plenty of room above decks to sunbathe, relax in the shade, have fun on the water slide, or take a splash in the 12 person spa, you will have the time of your life!
Tap the hotspots on the floor plan below to view the boat.

**Our Delicious Sample Menu**

All delicious catering is included in your trip over two days and nights, prepared freshly onboard by your crew. Check out the Clipper sample menu .
sample menu

**Departs/Returns**

Atlantic Clipper departs from Airlie Beach between 11:45 pm and 2:15 pm depending on the tide.
Please arrive at the Coral Sea Marina 15 minutes early to your allocated departure time.

Snorkel or dive amazing coral reefs, 'walk the plank', zip down a mega slide, or paddleboard around secluded bays - New Horizon has it all! This is just the start of the activities you can get your hand on while sailing the Whitsundays on New Horizon!
The best part about this tour is the flexibility to do your trip, your way. While there are plenty of action-packed activities you are also welcome to relax on the deck and soak up the sun!
New Horizon is also available for Private Charter.
Private Charter.

**Sample Itinerary**

**Show Less**

Whitehaven Beach Our stunningly famous beach is often referred to as one of the world's Top Ten Beaches, confirmed by Trip Advisor and Lonely Planet. The stark white sands and cool blue backdrop provide the perfect photo opportunity, making it the ideal place to snap some shots so you can walk away with incredible images to share with the world! Thousands of visitors come to the Whitsundays ever...
Whitehaven Beach
Snorkelling and scuba diving Explore some of the best reefs in the world, where you can snorkel and swim with the fish around the fringing coral reefs of the Whitsunday Islands. Immerse yourself into an underwater world, where you can see tropical fish, green sea turtles, colourful corals and more! Bring your GoPro along and be amazed by the clarity and colour below the surface, getting some footage and photos along the way. Snorkelling is included in the trip with several snorkelling opportunities on the itinerary. It is a must-do activity while sailing around the islands and offers one of the best ways to experience the fringing reefs of the Great Barrier Reef Marine Park. From the surface of the water, you can see the reef fish and corals up close, enjoying it in all its beauty. However, if you would like to dive further beneath the waves, New Horizon also offers passengers the wonderful opportunity to scuba dive! This is available for both certified divers and intro divers - Scuba dives are $99pp (maximum 1 dive per person). The price includes all gear hire and dive instructor. Please note intro divers are subject to age, conditions and medical questions and certified divers need to bring their dive certificate. All diving is subject to availability, MUST be pre-booked, and is paid for on board.
Snorkelling and scuba diving
Watersports - Mega slide, stand-up paddleboards and MORE! Stand-up paddleboarding is a great way to have some fun on the reef while you're at anchor! This challenging and exhilarating activity is a great excuse to spend some time on the water, making your way around the reefs. Hop on and cruise around the reef seeing it from a new point of view, trying your hand at this popular sport! This is the newest and most unique way to experience the calm waters of the Coral Sea while on board New Horizon. You can also get the adrenaline pumping by zipping down the mega inflatable slide, or test your inner pirate by daring yourself to 'walk the plank' before diving into the warm water below!

You can further tailor your charter by upgrading to the premium drinks packages and a choice of gourmet lunch options. With only six guests onboard with your own chef, you are guaranteed to have an incredible time sailing through the Whitsundays!
• Small group sailing tour

**Sample Itinerary**

**Show Less**

Whitehaven Beach
Snorkelling Leap into the unknown as you snorkel in the Whitsundays! A sleek, stylish and speedy maxi-yacht with air-conditioning, British Defender has space for 26 passengers (plus the professional and friendly crew), promising a vibrant social atmosphere where you'll not only make lifelong memories, but lifelong friends as well. 3 days of exploring this perfect little pocket of paradise will fly by like a dream that you just won't want to end!

On your Whitsundays voyage, you'll visit the spectacularly beautiful Whitehaven Beach! With the purest white silica sands in the world for as far as the eye can see (7km to be precise), this otherworldly location is the ideal place to spend a few hours frolicking in the sand, spotting epic marine life (such as turtles, juvenile reef sharks and sting rays), taking a snap at the iconic Whitehaven tree and soaking up the abundant rays of the North Queensland sunshine.
Snorkelling the Great Barrier Reef
On British Defender, you'll get lots of time time to fully explore the sensational subaquatic universe that comprise the fringing reefs of the Whitsundays! Your skipper will choose the best locations to visit on the day, meaning you get to experience the finest reefs in their most optimal conditions, and you are guaranteed see some of the most incredible marine life in the area.
From sea turtles to manta rays, humpback whales (June - September) to Maori Wrasse, reef sharks to dolphins, the Whitsunday Islands are home to all of these species, and there's a high chance you'll get to witness some of these while snorkelling here!

Defender carries a maximum of 28 guests plus 4 experienced crew members. Onboard are 6 double bunks, and 16 single bunks. Defender was constructed in 1989 and is 77 feet long.

This experience carries only 8 guests per trip, making for an enchanting and personalised adventure, ideal for slowing down and getting a true taste of the Whitsunday Islands. Whether you’re exploring the marvels of the Great Barrier Reef, relaxing aboard Kiana’s spacious deck or frolicking amongst the pristine sands of Whitehaven Beach, the Whitsundays is your oyster with Kiana! With private cabins, air-conditioning, sensational food and impressive features, this charming sailing vessel will take you on the journey of your dreams!
• All scuba dives included
• Exclusive access to the Outer Great Barrier Reef
• Extended, unique Reef tour

As one of few vessels to offer an immersive diving experience in the Outer Reef, Kiana provides diving for certified divers, with the additional opportunities to advance their skills with an add-on PADI Advanced course available. Snorkelling is also a fantastic way to see the spectacular reefs, making this trip accessible and incredible for everyone!
Important Information
• *Please note, all divers MUST be certified. Snorkellers welcome.
• This tour is suitable for guests ages 15+
• Dietary requirements (e.g. vegetarian, gluten-free, lactose intolerant etc.) will incur a fee of $10 per day. Please advise us upon booking of any allergies or requirements to ensure you can be catered for.

Each passenger must have a clear understanding of safety directions and instructions given in English by the crew and be able to complete the required safety forms in English. A passenger is only able to participate in water activities if they have a level of swimming experience. If a passenger is unable to swim they will still be able to participate in the sailing trip, but will not but able to participate in water activities such as snorkelling. In order to meet our minimum safety standards, passengers must be able to exit the vessel unassisted in the unlikely case of an emergency. If you have any questions please do not hesitate to ask us.

Diving
Kiana is one of the best sailing vessels renowned for its unforgettable diving experiences in the Outer Great Barrier Reef. Visiting a selection of untouched, vibrant spots brimming with marine life such as Bait Reef, Elizabeth Reef, Kennedy Reef, Seagull Reef, Net Reef and Wansfell Reef, guests can take advantage of exclusive reef access! Rub shoulders with manta rays, green sea turtles, plenty of tropical fish, giant Maori wrasse, white-tip reef sharks and more as you tick diving in the Great Barrier Reef off of your bucket list with utter splendour! The crew on board are all fully qualified Dive Instructors and Divemasters, with an additional add on PADI Advanced dive course available. All the dive equipment is new and the boat also includes its own diving compressors. Please note that scuba diving is subject to age, medical questionnaire and conditions.
Kiana is also the perfect boat for travellers to make a splash with a snorkel in the luminescent inner fringing and outer reefs. Glide over the surface and get up close with colourful hard and soft corals, swim through curious schools of glimmering fish and keep an eye out for sea turtles… the delights of the ocean are yours to experience! Kiana provides snorkelling gear, wetsuits and tuition so guests can explore the glistening waters and vibrant underwater ecosystems to their heart’s content!
Bait Reef & More!
Your time aboard Kiana is jampacked with trips to ecologically astounding reefs and dive spots such as Bait Reef, Elizabeth Reef, Kennedy Reef, Seagull Reef, Net Reef and Wansfell Reef! Bait Reef is home to a naturally-formed lagoon, perfect for overnight mooring, where you will wake up to the gentle sound of the ocean and unbroken horizon landscapes… simply a dream come true! Whether you’re an avid diver or donning a snorkel, these carefully selected reefs will show you the very best of the Great Barrier Reef!
Kiana will sail you out to Hook Island, with surrounding northern reefs that are simply brimming with incredible corals, wondrous sea creatures and breathtaking marinescapes. Renowned as the home to some of the best fringing reefs in the Whitsunday Islands, spots such as Mantaray Bay, Luncheon Bay and Mackeral Bay are bound to impress all lovers of the sea!

**Layout**

Kiana's upper decks are very spacious and provide permanently shaded areas for your protection. Below decks, the saloon is fully air-conditioned and fitted with timber-lined cabins to add to the luxurious feel of this magnificently appointed sailing vessel. Kiana offers four different accommodation styles.

Kiana visits all the best locations in the Whitsundays during your amazing three-day tour. Your crew will choose an itinerary based on the tides and weather conditions to make sure you make the most out of your tour and have the best experience possible.
Whitehaven Beach
You will spend an afternoon on the iconic Whitehaven Beach, one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. The pure white silica sands will stay cool under your feet as you explore around, taking the time to walk some of its 7km shores. Voted one of the best beaches in the world and the best in Australia, it is a favourite stop in the Whitsundays.
Diving is definitely a major focus on board, and our crew will ensure that even first-time divers feel safe and are able to enjoy the splendour of our magnificent coral reefs. The crew love to dive so much they want everyone to try scuba diving by offering the 1st scuba dive FREE ! This will allow you to relax with the equipment, feel comfortable underwater if it is the first time, and of course improve your abilities for future diving. The crew onboard are all fully qualified Dive Instructors and Divemasters. All the dive equipment is new and the boat also includes its own diving compressors. On this trip, you will visit some of the best dive and snorkelling site in the Whitsunday Islands, located at the north end of Hook Island. Sites such as Luncheon Bay, Mantaray Bay and Mackerel Bay will take your breath away. The beautiful soft and hard corals, diverse marine life and colourful finned residents provide the perfect playground for exploring, ideal for both snorkellers and divers. The gentle beach provides the perfect platform for first time divers, where they can ease themselves into the water.
Bait Reef
Bait Reef is the choice Outer Reef destination in the Whitsundays. It is totally protected under the Great Barrier Reef Plan of Management and is abundant in marine life and corals, ready to be explored. The natural lagoon provides a safe haven for overnight mooring and is an Eden for snorkelling and scuba diving. Bait Reef is about 2 - 3 hours beyond the islands and provides a picturesque journey, with an unbroken horizon and beautiful blue waters.
Whale Watching
During June through September, each year vast number of whales migrate from Antarctica to the Whitsundays to give birth to calves and to mate. The most common whale that you will see during this period are humpbacks although occasionally other types such as minkies can be spotted.
